oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Tandem Benzylic Oxidation/Dihydroxylation of alpha-Vinyl- and alpha-Alkenylbenzyl Alcohols
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: FERNANDES, RA
KATTANGURU, P
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: CATALYTIC ASYMMETRIC DIHYDROXYLATION
ALDOL REACTION
ALLYLIC ALCOHOLS
AMINOHYDROXYLATION
OXIDATION
COMPLEX
OLEFINS
KETONES
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A de novo tandem benzylic oxidative dihydroxylation of alpha-vinyl- and alpha-alkenylbenzyl alcohols has been developed to give alpha,beta-dihydroxypropiophenones (= 2,3-dihydroxy-1-phenylpropan-1-ones) and alpha,beta-dihydroxyalkyl phenones. This method was shown to be substrate-selective and specific for the oxidation of benzylic alcohols.
